imgList.title: Browse
imgList.content: The Browse interface provides accession to the dataset based on different classifications, including COVID-19 single-cell RNA-seq data, COVID-19 bulk RNA-seq data, and other coronavirus data.

imgList.title: Search
imgList.content: The Search interface provides query results for (i) expression of genes with different thresholds in multiple data types, and (ii) gene expression under data-type-specificity, cell-type-specificity, and cell-subtype-specificity.

imgList.title: Data description
imgList.content: The results show the details of each dataset, including tissue information, sample sources, sample numbers, cell counts, cell types, and publications.

imgList.title: Cell feature
imgList.content: The results visualize the detailed distribution of cells and find differentially expressed genes in different clusters.

imgList.title: Cell proportion
imgList.content: The results show the proportion of cells in each sample, including (i) cell types and subtypes in the single-cell RNA-seq data, and (ii) the proportion of pseudo-cells calculated by Cibersort in the bulk RNA-seq data.

imgList.title: Differential expression
imgList.content: The module uses a standard and uniform pipeline for differential expression analysis of each dataset, with results provided for analysis in tabular form and visualization in volcano plot form.

imgList.title: Functional analysis
imgList.content: Exploring the differentially expressed genes (DEGs) biological functions based on Gene Ontology (GO) and Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes (KEGG) pathways.

imgList.title: Heat map
imgList.content: The results show the expression profile of high-variance genes in different cell types and subtypes.

imgList.title: Cell communication
imgList.content: The results explain Cell-Cell interaction and interaction strength between different cell types and subtypes.

imgList.title: Cell differentiation
imgList.content: The results reconstruct and visualize cell trajectory in the whole differentiation process.
